Class Server

java.lang.Object
com.audiostreaming.Server
public class Server extends Object
Audio streaming server that forwards UDP audio frames between clients and maintains a TCP control channel for registration, presence, and commands such as JOIN, LEAVE, MUTE, and UNMUTE.

Responsibilities:

  • Accept TCP connections and register clients, assigning incremental IDs
  • Track client presence and state (ACTIVE, MUTED, LEFT, DISCONNECTED)
  • Receive UDP audio packets from senders and forward in-order frames to other clients
  • Run periodic heartbeats to detect stale TCP connections and time out inactive clients
Concurrency model:
  • One thread accepting TCP control connections
  • One background scheduler for heartbeats and cleanup
  • A worker pool for UDP packet processing and forwarding

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server(DatagramSocket socket) throws Exception
      Creates a server instance bound to the provided UDP socket.
      Parameters:
      socket - the UDP socket used to receive and forward audio packets
      Throws:
      Exception - if initialization fails

  • Method Details

    • startTCPServer

      public void startTCPServer() throws Exception
      Starts the TCP control server, binding to port 4444 by default.

      If port 4444 is unavailable, the server falls back to an ephemeral port assigned by the OS. The actual port in use can be queried via getTcpPort().

      Throws:
      Exception - if the server socket cannot be created or bound

    • startTCPServer

      public void startTCPServer(ServerSocket providedSocket) throws Exception
      Starts the TCP acceptor loop using the provided, pre-bound server socket.

      Useful for tests that need to bind to an ephemeral port first and then delegate to the server to run the accept loop.

      Parameters:
      providedSocket - a server socket that is already created and bound
      Throws:
      Exception - if the accept loop fails to start or runtime errors occur

    • heartbeat

      public void heartbeat() throws Exception
      Periodic maintenance task that:
      • Marks clients DISCONNECTED after a timeout with no UDP packets
      • Removes long-disconnected clients after a grace period
      • Sends a lightweight heartbeat over TCP to detect closed client sockets
      Throws:
      Exception - on I/O or scheduling errors

    • udpReceive

      public void udpReceive() throws Exception
      Receives UDP packets from clients in a loop and dispatches processing to the worker pool.

      Exits gracefully when the UDP socket is closed as part of shutdown.

      Throws:
      Exception - if UDP receive or task submission fails

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the server, closing TCP and UDP sockets, terminating background tasks, and clearing client state/mappings.

    • tcpConnection

      public void tcpConnection() throws Exception
      Starts a TCP accept loop by creating and binding a new ServerSocket.

      Similar to startTCPServer(), but performs the bind inside this method and then runs the accept loop.

      Throws:
      Exception - if binding or accepting connections fails

    • getTcpPort

      public int getTcpPort()
      Returns the TCP port the control server is currently listening on.
      Returns:
      the bound TCP port, or -1 if the TCP server is not running

    • processPacket

      public void processPacket(byte[] data, InetAddress srcAddr, int srcPort) throws Exception
      Processes a single UDP audio packet: performs basic validation, updates sequencing, buffers in-order frames, and forwards them to other eligible clients.
      Parameters:
      data - the raw UDP packet bytes
      srcAddr - the source IP address the packet came from
      srcPort - the source UDP port the packet came from
      Throws:
      Exception - if deserialization or forwarding fails
